channel.title: GUI Help
channel.description: How would I go about embedding a Browser into my gui. exe gave me the idea but he can't remember what you do. does anyone know how to?

item.title: GUI Help
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:21, topic:144107”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=197610.msg1773042#msg1773042 date=1190488298]
You don’t think it will? You can use it to go to SMF forums and such. You just cannot go here because of the fking cookie
[/quote]

uc.setRequestProperty(“Cookie”, “mpr_agree=yes”);[/quote]

Ya, but that is if you like to do the whole thing by hand. Unless you can modify the Request Properties of the JEditorPane, which idk.

Read full topic

item.title: GUI Help
item.dc:creator: @the_angel_of_death the angel of death
item.description:
@the_angel_of_death wrote:

Can lock this I have a complete reference book on java No need for help on this now.

item.title: GUI Help
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Taharok:

You don’t think it will? You can use it to go to SMF forums and such. You just cannot go here because of the fking cookie

uc.setRequestProperty(“Cookie”, “mpr_agree=yes”);

Read full topic

item.title: GUI Help
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:19, topic:144107”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=197610.msg1771936#msg1771936 date=1190446120]

angel, open a URL and channel the output of the InputStream into a JEditorPane (or something similar) with the content set to text/html.

You can actually just have JEditorPane do it all for you.

http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/api/javax/swing/JEditorPane.html#JEditorPane(java.lang.URL)
[/quote]
You still have to parse CSS and stuff.[/quote]

You don’t think it will? You can use it to go to SMF forums and such. You just cannot go here because of the fking cookie

Read full topic

item.title: GUI Help
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:18, topic:144107”][quote author=Rictoo link=topic=197610.msg1770612#msg1770612 date=1190375671]
angel, open a URL and channel the output of the InputStream into a JEditorPane (or something similar) with the content set to text/html.
[/quote]

You can actually just have JEditorPane do it all for you.

http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/api/javax/swing/JEditorPane.html#JEditorPane(java.lang.URL)[/quote]
You still have to parse CSS and stuff.

Who needs tutorials when what the class can do and its explanations are right in front of you?
[/quote]It’s still nice, tbh.

It is when you are trying to learn a new class, sort of.[/quote]Well, things like BCEL, I definitely needed an example.

Don’t be a noob.[/quote]
